2018-09-02T12:46:12Z: Driver, TeamHamilton, MercedesRaikkonen, FerrariVerstappen, Red BullBottas, MercedesVettel, FerrariGrosjean, HaasOcon, Force IndiaPerez, Force IndiaSainz, RenaultStroll, Williams
2018-09-02T15:00:45Z: That's it for our live coverage of a breathless Italian Grand Prix. Thanks for joining us.
2018-09-02T14:42:53Z: Hamilton looks really pumped. That was a great drive from the championship leader - definitely one of his best.
2018-09-02T14:42:10Z: Predictable boos from the crowd as the Mercedes drivers head to the podium.
2018-09-02T14:40:26Z: Haas is delighted with how Grosjean managed the pressure from the Force India drivers to claim sixth.
2018-09-02T14:38:46Z: Verstappen clearly disappointed to miss the podium, but he deserved that penalty for moving twice on the straight, regardless of the minimal space he left Bottas on the outside.
2018-09-02T14:36:16Z: Final classification: 1 Hamilton, 2 Raikkonen, 3 Bottas, 4 Vettel, 5 Verstappen, 6 Grosjean, 7 Ocon, 8 Perez, 9 Sainz, 10 Stroll, 11 Sirotkin, 12 Leclerc, 13 Vandoorne, 14 Hulkenberg, 15 Gasly, 16 Ericsson, 17 Magnussen. Not classified: Ricciardo, Alonso, Hartley.
2018-09-02T14:32:11Z: Result: 1 Hamilton; 2 Raikkonen; 3 Bottas; 4 Vettel; 5 Verstappen; 6 Grosjean; 7 Ocon; 8 Perez; 9 Sainz; 10 Stroll; 11 Sirotkin; 12 Leclerc; 13 Vandoorne; 14 Hulkenberg; 15 Gasly; 16 Ericsson; 17 Magnussen
2018-09-02T14:31:59Z: Sainz and Stroll round out the points finishers.
2018-09-02T14:31:43Z: Grosjean fends off the Force Indias to take sixth.
2018-09-02T14:31:02Z: Raikkonen takes second, Verstappen crosses the line third but that will become fifth as Bottas and Vettel are moved up to third and fourth.
2018-09-02T14:30:39Z: Hamilton wins the Italian Grand Prix and gives his title hopes another big boost
2018-09-02T14:29:40Z: Bottas is having another go at passing Verstappen on the road, but it doesn't come off.
2018-09-02T14:29:28Z: Vettel does his best lap of the race to make sure he'll jump Verstappen.
2018-09-02T14:28:47Z: Raikkonen lets Sirotkin unlap himself as he tries to nurse his tyres to the finish. Then re-laps the Williams.
2018-09-02T14:27:40Z: Vettel is now within 4.8s so that's fourth place when Verstappen takes his punishment.
2018-09-02T14:26:52Z: Ocon within DRS range of Grosjean now in the battle for sixth.
2018-09-02T14:26:25Z: Hamilton's lead over Raikkonen is up to 7.1s with four laps left.
2018-09-02T14:25:43Z: Vettel is now within 6.2s of the stubborn Verstappen, so the Red Bull driver is looking ever more likely to lose two places with his penalty.
2018-09-02T14:24:59Z: Bottas attacks Verstappen on the outside into the first chicane. That doesn't work, so he tries the outside at the Roggia too. And again Verstappen holds him off.
2018-09-02T14:24:09Z: Everything is pretty settled now in the midfield, though Perez is closing on Ocon and isn't far from picking up DRS now.
2018-09-02T14:23:43Z: Vettel is now within 7.5s of Verstappen and was again over a second quicker. Looking good for Vettel to salvage fourth when Verstappen's penalty is applied.
2018-09-02T14:22:04Z: Raikkonen has obeyed Ferrari's instruction to just bring the car home and is now 4.2s behind Hamilton.
2018-09-02T14:21:43Z: Bottas is right behind Verstappen on the road now.
2018-09-02T14:21:09Z: Can Vettel benefit from Verstappen's penalty too? He's 9.8s behind with seven laps to go but his last lap was 1.4s quicker than the Red Bull.
2018-09-02T14:20:23Z: Bottas is back within 1.8s of Verstappen so that penalty hands the Mercedes third.
2018-09-02T14:20:03Z: Verstappen is given a 5s time penalty for squeezing Bottas off the road.
2018-09-02T14:18:57Z: Hamilton immediately pulls out a 1.5s lead over Raikkonen.
2018-09-02T14:18:44Z: Raikkonen tried to defend the inside but Hamilton could not be held back and this time there was no chance to retaliate.
2018-09-02T14:18:21Z: Hamilton makes it through, he takes the lead on the outside into the Rettifilo with eight laps to go!
2018-09-02T14:18:05Z: Hamilton is right with Raikkonen and goes for the lead...
2018-09-02T14:18:01Z: Ericsson did 41 laps on a set of supersofts before finally diving into the pits. He drops to 16th, ahead of only the compromised Haas of Magnussen. Time for a late charge on fresh rubber from the Sauber driver.
2018-09-02T14:17:26Z: Back to the Verstappen/Bottas incident - the Mercedes was alongside on the outside and they rubbed wheels. Bottas is adamant Verstappen squeezed him off. It's being investigated.
2018-09-02T14:16:49Z: Raikkonen is now having to defend from Hamilton.
2018-09-02T14:16:39Z: A replay shows that was actually contact between Verstappen and Bottas.
2018-09-02T14:16:13Z: Bottas attacks Verstappen again but it fails and he cuts the chicane, losing ground as he has to navigate the corner markers in the escape road.
2018-09-02T14:15:09Z: The leaders are hitting heavy traffic with Hamilton 0.7s behind Raikkonen and 11 laps left.
2018-09-02T14:15:07Z: Stroll has just passed Hulkenberg for 10th so no point staying out much longer for the Renault driver.
2018-09-02T14:14:22Z: Bottas is now right with Verstappen for third and has a look at the first corner.
2018-09-02T14:14:05Z: Now the pitstops have cycled through, Grosjean is back up to sixth (and the 'Class B' lead) for Haas.
2018-09-02T14:13:19Z: Hamilton is getting big bites of DRS behind Raikkonen now, but he's not close enough early enough to try any moves on the pits straight. On lap 41 of 53 now.
2018-09-02T14:12:40Z: Perez rejoins eighth, ahead of Hulkenberg, Sainz is 10th behind the sister Renault.
2018-09-02T14:12:31Z: Vettel's pace at the moment is the same as Verstappen's in third and slower than Bottas in fourth, so it looks like Ferrari's title contender is heading for fifth.
2018-09-02T14:12:01Z: Bottas has closed to within 1.7s of Verstappen for third.
2018-09-02T14:11:57Z: Sainz and Perez both into the pits now.
2018-09-02T14:11:49Z: Hamilton closed right in on Raikkonen under braking for the first chicane that time.
2018-09-02T14:11:34Z: Now up to fifth again, Vettel is 13.4s behind Bottas with 14 laps to go. He's on supersofts, Bottas is on softs - but the Mercedes' tyres are much newer. Go on, Vettel, give it a punt.
2018-09-02T14:11:31Z: Hulkenberg is 10th but his tyres are very old so he's unlikely to hang on to a point.
2018-09-02T14:10:46Z: Red Bull tells Verstappen not to worry about Vettel catching him before the end of the race as it thinks that's unlikely, but it does tells him to keep up the pace.
2018-09-02T14:10:42Z: Replays show Vettel passed Perez into Ascari.
2018-09-02T14:10:24Z: Ocon pits out of fifth place, so Vettel gains another place.
2018-09-02T14:10:17Z: Raikkonen slightly faster than Hamilton on that lap, but there's nothing (well, 0.04s to be exact) between their pace.
2018-09-02T14:09:50Z: Vettel is past Perez and back up into the top six now in the second Ferrari.
2018-09-02T14:09:17Z: Vettel has DRS on Perez now.
2018-09-02T14:08:58Z: So 15 laps to go, Raikkonen leads Hamilton by 0.739s and the Ferrari has an ugly stripe around the middle of its left-rear tyre. Tense.
2018-09-02T14:08:18Z: Bottas has rejoined 3.6s behind Verstappen in fourth. Can he take advantage of his newer tyres to make the move he couldn't in the first stint?
2018-09-02T14:08:07Z: Leclerc has repassed Vandoorne and is back up to 14th now.
2018-09-02T14:07:32Z: So now Raikkonen leads from Hamilton by 1.1s, but Mercedes is right to highlight that Raikkonen has a rough-looking rear tyre.
2018-09-02T14:07:13Z: Bottas finally pits from the lead on lap 36, and falls to fourth behind Verstappen.
2018-09-02T14:06:42Z: Stroll has been in too and he rejoins 13th.
2018-09-02T14:06:17Z: Leclerc and Gasly have been into the pits, which drops them both behind Vandoorne's McLaren.
2018-09-02T14:05:45Z: Raikkonen pitted on lap 20, Bottas has now kept his supersofts going for 35 laps.
2018-09-02T14:05:27Z: This is looking better for Raikkonen, at least for now - he's closer to Bottas than Hamilton is to him.
2018-09-02T14:04:55Z: The top three lap Vandoorne without drama.
2018-09-02T14:03:57Z: Mercedes urges Hamilton to keep an eye on tyre temperatures as it's sure Raikkonen is going to hit trouble on that front.
2018-09-02T14:03:53Z: Vettel has passed Sainz and is up to seventh now.
2018-09-02T14:03:35Z: That lock-up has cost Hamilton a bit of momentum, he falls back to 0.7s off Raikkonen.
2018-09-02T14:03:08Z: The top three are approaching traffic too.
2018-09-02T14:02:55Z: Only 0.7s covering Bottas, Raikkonen and Hamilton now with 20 laps to go. Hamilton locks up, has he got a flat spot?
2018-09-02T14:02:25Z: Pitstop Betting is the newest betting experience made for Motorsport fans. Download today.
2018-09-02T14:02:12Z: The top three are now within a second, Hamilton is right back with Raikkonen.
2018-09-02T14:01:31Z: Raikkonen is within 0.4s of Bottas but still doesn't try a full-on move for the lead.
2018-09-02T14:01:09Z: Hamilton is now back within 1.6s of Raikkonen's tail.
2018-09-02T14:00:56Z: Vettel passes Stroll too now, so that's eighth place with ease on the approach to Turn 1.
2018-09-02T14:00:42Z: Bottas has just done his own best lap of the race so far, so while in roadblock duty he's also got a shot at jumping Verstappen for third still.
2018-09-02T13:59:54Z: Renault suggests a setting adjustment to prevent front brake locking on Hulkenberg's car.
2018-09-02T13:59:37Z: Hamilton takes 1.5s out of Raikkonen with another new fastest lap.
2018-09-02T13:59:29Z: Vettel passes Sirotkin to take ninth.
2018-09-02T13:59:06Z: Raikkonen is within DRS range of Bottas but unable to try a move yet.
2018-09-02T13:58:53Z: Hamilton does the fastest lap of the race and is back within 3.2s of Raikkonen.
2018-09-02T13:58:35Z: Vettel rejoins 10th. He's ahead of Grosjean, who led the midfield pack before the pitstop cycle, so should move back up the order as the cars ahead pit out of his way.
2018-09-02T13:57:47Z: Vettel pits for a second time and goes back onto supersofts. That's the run-to-the-end-and-get-a-podium hope over.
2018-09-02T13:57:19Z: Raikkonen is now within a second of Bottas for the race lead. Will Bottas do much to hold the Ferrari back?
2018-09-02T13:56:36Z: Hamilton has rejoined 5.4s behind Raikkonen having been within a second of him until that decision to stay out longer.
2018-09-02T13:56:12Z: And as soon as he appears on the Force India's tail, Verstappen is through and into fifth.
2018-09-02T13:55:53Z: Verstappen has closed in on the yet-to-stop Ocon for fifth.
2018-09-02T13:55:39Z: Hamilton rejoins in third behind temporary leader Bottas and Raikkonen.
2018-09-02T13:55:27Z: Raikkonen does a new fastest lap...
2018-09-02T13:54:56Z: Raikkonen has got the gap to Hamilton down to 18.2s, how much damage can Bottas now do?
2018-09-02T13:54:05Z: Raikkonen is now within 2.6s of the yet-to-stop Bottas in second and catching him fast...
2018-09-02T13:53:48Z: Verstappen is of course behind Vettel too, which means if Vettel can take his soft tyres right to the end he's potentially heading for third now.
2018-09-02T13:52:53Z: The marshals successfully clear Ricciardo's car without needing a safety car, so Ferrari can relax there.
2018-09-02T13:52:15Z: Raikkonen is now within 19.2s of Hamilton. A safety car to tidy up Ricciardo's car would be bad news for Ferrari.
2018-09-02T13:51:58Z: Could not be the engine's fault of course, but looks likely based on the smoke pouring out the back and the air intake as the car is moved away.
2018-09-02T13:51:36Z: Verstappen and Bottas have stayed out too in second and third, and they're now 1.3s apart.
2018-09-02T13:51:17Z: Raikkonen does the fastest first sector of the race so far and takes another half-second out of Hamilton. Unless it rains, this Mercedes strategy looks unlikely to work.
2018-09-02T13:50:46Z: Renault had concerns about the reliability of the new C-spec. What could this mean for Verstappen?
2018-09-02T13:50:31Z: Now fifth, Vettel is 31.6s behind yet-to-stop leader Hamilton. If he can keep his soft tyres going to the end, a podium is still on.
2018-09-02T13:50:12Z: Familiar smoke pouring from the car as he pulls off the circuit.
2018-09-02T13:49:59Z: Hamilton stays out again, but his advantage over the flying Raikkonen is down to 20.8s.
2018-09-02T13:49:31Z: Vettel dives past Ocon on the brakes into the first chicane. The Ferrari is fifth now thanks to Grosjean's stop.
2018-09-02T13:48:42Z: Raikkonen bangs in the fastest lap of anyone so far, a 1m23.535s, and gets the gap down to 22.1s.
2018-09-02T13:47:54Z: Vettel has DRS on Ocon now.
2018-09-02T13:47:30Z: Raikkonen is 0.043s quicker than Hamilton on that lap overall. The gap is 22.5s.
2018-09-02T13:47:05Z: An agitated Raikkonen raises a query about the battery, but is reassured and given instructions for a setting change.
2018-09-02T13:46:37Z: Raikkonen is 23.0s behind Hamilton in fourth now, and just lost four tenths in the first sector and another tenth in the next one.
2018-09-02T13:46:04Z: Ricciardo has DRS on Sirotkin now.
2018-09-02T13:45:20Z: But Raikkonen beats Hamilton's sector time immediately. Is Hamilton pitting or staying out?
2018-09-02T13:44:17Z: Raikkonen switches to softs and rejoins in fourth ahead of Grosjean.
2018-09-02T13:44:04Z: Raikkonen pits from the lead at the end of lap 20 of 53.
2018-09-02T13:43:52Z: Vettel made the pass at the first chicane.
2018-09-02T13:43:40Z: Vettel zooms down the inside of Sainz's Renault to take seventh.
2018-09-02T13:43:23Z: Bottas has stuck with Verstappen and is very much within DRS range of third.
2018-09-02T13:43:17Z: Vettel is now within DRS range of Sainz.
2018-09-02T13:43:05Z: Hamilton is now within half a second of Raikkonen again, the closest it's been since they were overtaking each other.
2018-09-02T13:42:04Z: Bottas has closed in on Verstappen and has a half-look at taking third. Both lock up and make a mess of the first chicane.
2018-09-02T13:41:01Z: Vettel gets the move done properly this time, with no resistance from Perez. That's eighth now for the title contender.
2018-09-02T13:40:20Z: Hamilton gets the gap to Raikkonen down to six tenths of a second as both lap the delayed Magnussen.
2018-09-02T13:40:02Z: Hulkenberg up to 13th now after passing Gasly.
2018-09-02T13:39:49Z: Vettel dives late out of Perez's slipstream and passes into Turn 1, but misses the braking point and gives the position straight back as he attempts to make the corner.
2018-09-02T13:38:56Z: Ricciardo is stuck in 12th at the moment, with 4.5s to make up on Sirotkin's Williams.
2018-09-02T13:37:58Z: Vettel makes an easy pass on Stroll to take ninth approaching the first chicane.
2018-09-02T13:37:25Z: Raikkonen gets his lead up to 1.4s briefly with a very strong final sector, but Hamilton carries more speed through the first chicane and the gap is quickly back down to under a second.
2018-09-02T13:36:19Z: Vettel flew pas Sirotkin on the inside approaching Ascari.
2018-09-02T13:36:17Z: Lead gaps on lap 14: 1 Raikkonen; 2 Hamilton +1.0s; 3 Verstappen +7.0s; 4 Bottas +8.2s
2018-09-02T13:35:55Z: Vettel says he thinks he has some damage, but Ferrari can see nothing troubling on the data.
2018-09-02T13:35:34Z: Vettel into the top 10 now after passing Sirotkin.
2018-09-02T13:35:18Z: Ocon passes Sainz to take sixth into the first chicane. Easy DRS pass there.
2018-09-02T13:34:57Z: Perez is driving an excellent race after his Q1 exit yesterday. He's within 3.5s of Ocon, who started inside the top 10, and closing on Stroll.
2018-09-02T13:33:36Z: Perez has taken Sirotkin for ninth.
2018-09-02T13:33:10Z: Raikkonen still can't quite get rid of Hamilton - the gap hasn't got above 1.2s yet and it's now fluctuating between 0.7s and 0.9s.
2018-09-02T13:33:04Z: This time he gets it done neatly on the brakes into Turn 1, but not much resistance from Gasly...
2018-09-02T13:32:58Z: Download the Pitstop Betting app. Play along today.
2018-09-02T13:32:33Z: Ricciardo has finally got past Gasly now.
2018-09-02T13:32:20Z: Perez challenges Sirotkin at the first chicane but has to give best on the outside line.
2018-09-02T13:31:23Z: Hulkenberg breezes past Leclerc on the main straight to take 14th as Gasly hangs tough against Ricciardo, with more contact at the first chicane as Ricciardo sent one up the inside.
2018-09-02T13:31:12Z: We're now on lap 11 of this 53-lap race, which is almost certain to be a one-stopper. Raikkonen gets his lead up to 1.2s.
2018-09-02T13:30:34Z: Third-placed Verstappen has fallen 5.3s behind the leaders now but is still not having to do anything too interesting to resist Bottas.
2018-09-02T13:30:19Z: Vettel up to 11th now, while Ricciardo has got past Leclerc for 13th.
2018-09-02T13:29:51Z: Fastest lap to Hamilton now, a 1m24.349s, but on the next lap a stronger middle sector for Raikkonen rebuilds the gap to 1.1s.
2018-09-02T13:29:09Z: Suggestions of some minor damage to the Red Bull after a touch with Gasly earlier.
2018-09-02T13:28:49Z: Leclerc holds Ricciardo off into Ascari.
2018-09-02T13:28:37Z: Vettel is past Leclerc now too as the Sauber has a slide coming out of the second chicane.
2018-09-02T13:28:19Z: Vettel cleverly blocked the inside after the move, knowing Ricciardo's reputation for late lunges on the brakes.
2018-09-02T13:28:15Z: Hamilton is closing back in on Raikkonen for the lead - the gap is down to 0.8s again.
2018-09-02T13:27:59Z: Vettel breezes past on the straight.
2018-09-02T13:27:41Z: Vettel has a look at passing Ricciardo into Parabolica!
2018-09-02T13:26:50Z: Bottas is just about a second behind Vertappen in the battle for third but not really hassling the Red Bull.
2018-09-02T13:26:48Z: Leclerc gets past Gasly right behind them.
2018-09-02T13:26:36Z: Perez finally passes Alonso approaching Turn 1.
2018-09-02T13:26:30Z: Raikkonen reclaims fastest lap, his 1m24.538s brings his lead up to 1.1s and out of range for Hamilton's DRS radar.
2018-09-02T13:26:09Z: Perez is jinking around in Alonso's slipstream.
2018-09-02T13:25:49Z: They won't be set for running in traffic like this given he started at the front.
2018-09-02T13:25:08Z: Perez tries to pass Alonso at Turn 1 but Alonso hangs on by defending the inside.
2018-09-02T13:24:39Z: Now Hamilton grabs fastest lap with a 1m24.827s, but that's only 0.032s better than Raikkonen.
2018-09-02T13:24:37Z: Vettel and Ricciardo have both got past Hulkenberg's Renault.
2018-09-02T13:24:20Z: The Force India definitely lost some bodywork in that incident so Perez's pace could be compromised.
2018-09-02T13:24:10Z: Lead gaps: 1 Raikkonen; 2 Hamilton +0.9s; 3 Verstappen +3.4s; 4 Bottas +4.5s
2018-09-02T13:23:54Z: Replays show Magnussen and Perez made contact at the Lesmos. That explains Magnussen dropping back.
2018-09-02T13:23:38Z: Another fastest lap from Raikkonen inches his lead up to a touch under a second.
2018-09-02T13:23:00Z: The stewards say no action will be taken over the Vettel/Hamilton clash.
2018-09-02T13:22:50Z: Vettel is 16th now and on a charge.
2018-09-02T13:22:48Z: Verstappen and Bottas are already being dropped by Raikkonen and Hamilton, who are 2.7s clear up front.
2018-09-02T13:22:42Z: Ricciardo and Vettel both pass Vandoorne at the second chicane.
2018-09-02T13:22:05Z: Hulkenberg is up to 14th. Ricciardo is running 16th.
2018-09-02T13:21:59Z: Hamilton is still witihin 0.7s of Raikkonen for the lead.
2018-09-02T13:21:30Z: Hamilton had a massive tow on Raikkonen out of the Parabolica at the restart and breezed past, but Raikkonen was much later on the brakes into the Roggia in his brilliant reply.
2018-09-02T13:20:47Z: Sainz tries to pass Grosjean at Turn 1 but can't make the corner.
2018-09-02T13:20:37Z: Raikkonen immediately attacks Hamilton again and he retakes the lead around the outside into the Roggia chicane!
2018-09-02T13:20:19Z: Hamilton goes down the outside of Raikkonen into the first chicane and takes the lead!
2018-09-02T13:20:04Z: Raikkonen backs Hamilton up as they head for the restart, but the Mercedes attacks...
2018-09-02T13:19:44Z: Looks like the contact broke his suspension.
2018-09-02T13:19:32Z: Replays show Hartley was squeezed between Vandoorne and Ericsson off the start.
2018-09-02T13:19:24Z: The safety car is coming in.
2018-09-02T13:18:48Z: Alonso managed to jump both Gasly and Magnussen in the melee. The McLaren is into the points already thanks to the Hamilton/Vettel incident.
2018-09-02T13:18:47Z: Replays of the start show Vettel initially came under a bit of pressure from Hamilton immediately off the line, but Vettel then pulled clear and was alongside Raikkonen into the first corner. Raikkonen locked up but held the lead. Then Hamilton went down the outside into the second chicane, where the Ferrari's right-front wheel made contact with the Mercedes' sidepod.
2018-09-02T13:18:11Z: Ocon made a strong start but was boxed in at Turn 1. Magnussen had to cut the corner.
2018-09-02T13:17:20Z: Hartley's car is being craned away. Ericsson came into the pits so perhaps they made contact at the start.
2018-09-02T13:16:51Z: Hulkenberg and Ricciardo have both taken advantage of the safety car to make a pit stop, after starting at the back.
2018-09-02T13:16:12Z: Raikkonen still leads ahead of Hamilton, with Verstappen ahead of Bottas in third. Vettel is into the pits for a new front wing.
2018-09-02T13:15:34Z: Hamilton went around the outside of Vettel into the Roggia, Vettel stayed alongside and then spun mid-corner. He's got going again but has damage.
2018-09-02T13:14:42Z: Vettel spins at the second chicane!
2018-09-02T13:14:28Z: Raikkonen holds the lead into the first corner, amid attacks from Vettel and Hamilton.
2018-09-02T13:12:38Z: Raikkonen and Vettel pull up on the Monza grid.
2018-09-02T13:10:51Z: The field sets off for the formation lap with the two Ferraris up front.
2018-09-02T13:10:12Z: The grid is now being cleared.
2018-09-02T13:10:01Z: It's easy to miss considering that Williams has usually brought up the rear of the field, but Lance Stroll's race starts have become arguably his best skill in F1.Lining up in 10th, Williams's first top 10 this year, Stroll could make things more tricky for the likes of Sainz, Ocon and Gasly.
2018-09-02T13:06:57Z: Bottas has trailed Mercedes team-mate Hamilton consistently during this weekend, but did make inroads in qualifying. Will he have anything for Hamilton today? 2018-09-02T12:48:27Z: After a front row lockout, this looks like Ferrari's best chance to end its home race victory drought. But one of the key questions set to be answered is if Ferrari will allow Raikkonen to stay ahead of Vettel, considering the German is in title contention with Lewis Hamilton - who starts the race in third.Vettel believes Raikkonen will be allowed to fight for the win: Vettel: Ferrari F1 team-mate Raikkonen can race for Italian GP winSebastian Vettel says his Ferrari Formula 1 team-mate Kimi Raikkonen is allowed to race for the win in the Italian Grand Prix after claiming pole position at Monza
2018-09-02T12:46:46Z: Hello and welcome to our live coverage of the Italian Grand Prix.
